snippet: The distributor Bingham Ray, who died on Jan. 23, never abandoned his commitment to risky, visionary cinema.
abstract: Film distributor Bingham Ray kept true to his belief in risky, independent, visionary cinema until his death on January 23; Ray is described as one of Hollywood's few heroic figures, with a love of movies and a morality about his work in Hollywood's 'off-Hollywood.'
lead_paragraph: The distributor Bingham Ray, who died on Jan. 23, never abandoned his commitment to risky, visionary cinema.

headline.seo: Bingham Ray, Light of October Films and Daring Cinema
headline.main: An Indie Champion and His Life’s Labors
headline.print_headline: An Indie Champion And His Life’s Labors
